data.event: The brewery first opened in 1873 when the William Butler and Company needed bigger premises than their existing site in Priestfield.

event.title: started at Springfield during the following year

data.event: Production started at Springfield during the following year.

event.title: production from 400 to 1,500 barrels a week

data.event: Between 1881-3 a new brewing tower was constructed, enabling William Butler and Company to increase production from 400 to 1,500 barrels a week.
In 1960 Mitchell's and Butler's acquired the company and the Cape Hill brewery kept the Springfield Brewery open.
Brewing stopped around 1990 and the site was used simply as distribution centre.
